trigger: Persistent Expression of the Embryonic <extra_id_0> Globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> epsilony <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , in <extra_id_0> Sox6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Deficient Mice

The <extra_id_0> epsilony globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene was initially identified as an upregulated transcript in the p100H mouse using subtractive hybridization to identify <extra_id_0> Sox6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> downstream targets .

This initial observation was confirmed in an independent knock-out allele of <extra_id_0> Sox6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 13 ] using real-time polymerase chain reaction ( PCR ) ( unpublished data ) .
Real-time PCR was used to quantitate the expression levels of other globin genes in p100H mutant and WT mouse livers at two developmental stages , 15.5 dpc and 18.5 dpc .

As shown in Figure 1 , the <extra_id_0> epsilony <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene is expressed at high levels at both time points in mutant mice , in contrast to the decline in expression observed in WT mice .
No difference was seen between WT and heterozygous mice ( unpublished data ) .

Interestingly , the expression levels of the other two embryonic <extra_id_0> globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> genes ( <extra_id_0> zeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> betah1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) are also higher in p100H homozygous mice , compared with WT mice , but to a much lesser extent than seen for <extra_id_0> epsilony globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> at 18.5 dpc ( Figure 1 ) .
Moreover , the expression level of adult <extra_id_0> beta globin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is also somewhat higher in p100H homozygous mice than in WT mice at 18.5 dpc ( Figure 1 ) .
Perinatal lethality of mutant mice ( presumably from the heart defect [ 14 ] ) precludes us from evaluating postnatal globin expression .
The graphs in Figure 1 illustrate real time PCR results that were performed in triplicate ( standard deviation of the data is shown by error bars ) .

Because all of the assays were performed at the same time with the same internal control , the levels shown are relative levels and are thus comparable across all samples and are in agreement with previously published results for WT fetal mice [ 29 ] .

We note that the level of <extra_id_0> epsilony <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in the livers of 15.5 dpc and 18.5 dpc homozygous mutant mice is statistically equivalent to the level of <extra_id_0> betamaj <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> min <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in the livers of 15.5 dpc and 18.5 dpc homozygous WT mice .
